abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Malawi Fiscal Management
            and Accelerating Growth Program were as follows: outcomes
            were highly satisfactory, sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was moderate, and the Bank
            performance and the Borrower performance were both highly
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: 1. Adjustment
            operations should not be complex for countries with weak
            implementation capacity; 2. Design of the adjustment
            operations need to be thoroughly worked out to avoid
            implementation delays; and 3. Expectations should be
            realistic in the case of transforming the state-run operations.
